episodeTitle: Luffy Defeated?! The Hour of Hody's Revenge
description: As Noah descends toward Fish-Man Island, Luffy battles Hody Jones underwater. After Hody destroys the ship's air bubble, Fukaboshi rescues Luffy and confronts Hody about his motivations. Hody consumes more Energy Steroids and grows stronger, while the Ammo Knights prepare a massive air bubble to save the island.

events.title: Manboshi Shields Shirahoshi from Hody's Attack
events.description: As Noah continues falling toward Fish-Man Island, Hody Jones attacks Shirahoshi while she desperately tries to wake Vander Decken IX. Manboshi intervenes and takes the brunt of Hody's attack to protect his sister.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Neptune brothers' devotion to protecting Shirahoshi and shows Hody's ruthlessness in attacking even while Noah threatens the island.

events.title: Luffy Destroys Hody's Kirisame Weapon
events.description: Luffy and Hody Jones clash in battle. Luffy manages to break off the scythe blade (Kirisame) on Hody's fin during the intense underwater combat.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's strength even while weakened underwater as a Devil Fruit user, and removes one of Hody's primary weapons.

events.title: Hody Bites Luffy - Haki's Limitation Revealed
events.description: Hody bites down on Luffy's shoulder with his powerful jaws. After Luffy punches him away, he explains that his Busoshoku Haki is effective against blunt attacks but not yet strong enough to fully protect against piercing damage.
events.significance: Important revelation about the limitations of Luffy's post-timeskip Haki training, showing he still has room for growth despite his two years of training.

quotes.text: My Busoshoku Haki is good for blunt attacks, but is not strong enough for my body to withstand piercing.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explains his Haki's current limitations after being bitten by Hody

events.title: Luffy Uses Haki-Imbued Jet Pistol
events.description: Luffy strikes Hody with a Jet Pistol enhanced with Busoshoku Haki, sending him flying. This demonstrates Luffy's ability to combine his pre-timeskip Gear Second techniques with his newly mastered Haki.
events.significance: Shows the evolution of Luffy's signature techniques with Haki enhancement, making them far more powerful than before the timeskip.

events.title: Hody Destroys the Air Bubble
events.description: Realizing that Luffy has the advantage in the air bubble, Hody Jones deliberately destroys the bubble surrounding the ship, flooding it with water to gain the advantage as a fish-man while leaving Luffy, a Devil Fruit user, at his mercy underwater.
events.significance: Critical tactical decision that puts Luffy in mortal danger and demonstrates Hody's cunning despite his brutal nature. This forces the battle into an environment where fish-men have overwhelming advantage.

events.title: Fukaboshi Rescues Luffy from Drowning
events.description: As Luffy struggles underwater after the air bubble is destroyed, Fukaboshi arrives and rescues him from drowning, then confronts Hody Jones himself.
events.significance: Shows the Neptune brothers' commitment to protecting not just their kingdom but also those trying to help them. Sets up Fukaboshi's direct confrontation with Hody.

events.title: Fukaboshi Uses Ultramarine
events.description: Fukaboshi demonstrates the Merman Combat technique 'Ultramarine,' grabbing water with his hands and hurling it forward in a massive torrent that blasts toward Hody with tremendous force.
events.significance: First appearance of Fukaboshi's Merman Combat abilities, showing the combat prowess of the Neptune princes and the water manipulation techniques unique to merfolk.

events.title: Hody Uses Umidaiko (Ocean Drum)
events.description: Hody Jones demonstrates the Fish-Man Karate technique 'Umidaiko' (Ocean Drum), punching the water in front of him and sending a powerful shockwave through it toward his opponent, striking with devastating force.
events.significance: Reveals Hody's Fish-Man Karate abilities, though later it's noted his technique is amateur level despite the raw power from Energy Steroids.

events.title: Fukaboshi Demands to Know Hody's Motivations
events.description: Fukaboshi confronts Hody Jones, demanding to know what humans did to him to make him hate them so much. He asks about Hody's past and what drove him to such extreme hatred and violence.
events.significance: Sets up the revelation of Hody's true nature - that his hatred isn't born from personal tragedy but from inherited prejudice, making him a symbol of cyclical hatred.

events.title: Hody Stabs Fukaboshi
events.description: During their confrontation, Hody Jones viciously stabs Fukaboshi, severely injuring the eldest Neptune prince despite his bravery in facing the villain.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hody's ruthlessness and the serious threat he poses even to powerful warriors like Fukaboshi. Shows the Neptune princes' sacrifice to protect their kingdom.

events.title: Hody Consumes More Energy Steroids and Transforms
events.description: Hody Jones shovels down additional Energy Steroids, causing him to undergo a dramatic physical transformation. His body becomes massively more muscular with bulging veins, he loses his belly, and his size greatly increases as the drugs amplify his power.
events.significance: Critical moment showing the dangerous power and side effects of Energy Steroids. This transformation makes Hody even more threatening but sets up his eventual downfall from the drugs' aging effects.

events.title: Ammo Knights Prepare Massive Air Bubble for Noah
events.description: Fukaboshi contacts the Ammo Knights with urgent orders to prepare a massive air bubble to surround the Noah. The knights note they only have one shot and it won't slow the ship's descent, but it could provide crucial breathing room for the battle.
events.significance: Shows the coordinated effort to save Fish-Man Island and creates the conditions needed for the final battle against Hody.

events.title: Neptune's Flashback: Noah and Joy Boy's Promise
events.description: Neptune recalls the ancient history of Noah - that centuries ago, a promise was made with a 'great man' (Joy Boy) to keep the ship on the ocean floor and wait. The ship was built as part of an agreement to use Poseidon's powers to raise it to the surface for the mass migration of Fish-Man Island's citizens.
events.significance: Reveals crucial world-building information about the Void Century, Joy Boy, and the ancient promise. Connects to the broader mysteries of One Piece including Poseidon and the True History.

events.title: Reference to Joy Boy's Broken Promise
events.description: The flashback reveals that Joy Boy failed to keep his promise for unknown reasons and left an apology on a Poneglyph in the Sea Forest, with the legacy that someone in the future will complete the promise.
events.significance: Major foreshadowing that Luffy will eventually fulfill Joy Boy's promise. This connects to endgame revelations about Luffy's true nature and destiny.

quotes.text: My Busoshoku Haki is good for blunt attacks, but is not strong enough for my body to withstand piercing.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Explaining Haki limitations after being bitten

themes.description: The episode explores how Hody's hatred of humans isn't based on personal experience but inherited prejudice, representing cyclical hatred passed down through generations.
themes.symbolism: Hody's motivations (to be fully revealed in the next episode) symbolize how hatred can perpetuate itself without reason.

themes.description: The Neptune brothers repeatedly put themselves in harm's way to protect Shirahoshi and their kingdom, while Luffy fights despite being at a severe disadvantage underwater.
themes.symbolism: The willingness of leaders to sacrifice for their people is a recurring theme.

themes.description: The revelation of Joy Boy's promise and Noah's true purpose connects to the larger themes of inherited will and destiny that run throughout One Piece.
themes.symbolism: Noah represents the unfulfilled promises of the past waiting for the right person to complete them.

themes.description: Hody's consumption of Energy Steroids shows the dangerous cost of seeking power through artificial means rather than genuine growth.
themes.symbolism: The steroids represent shortcuts to power that ultimately destroy the user.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his post-timeskip abilities but also reveals his current limitations, showing he still has room to grow despite two years of training.

characterSpotlights.development: Fukaboshi demonstrates his combat abilities, heroism, and determination to understand Hody's motivations. Despite being severely injured, he continues fighting for his people.

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode covers portions of two manga chapters (641 and 643) rather than following a single chapter linearly.

trivia.fact: This episode's English simulcast aired one day before the Japanese broadcast (September 1, 2012 vs September 2, 2012).
The technique Umidaiko (海太鼓) literally means 'Ocean Drum' in Japanese and is called 'Sea Drum' in the VIZ manga.
Ultramarine gets its name from 'ultramarinus,' literally meaning 'beyond the sea' in Latin, which is fitting for a merman combat technique.
Despite Hody's impressive display of power with Energy Steroids, both Luffy and Jinbe later note that his Fish-Man Karate is at an amateur level.
